    • Method Detail

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Description copied from class: PaintTool
        Deactivates the tool on the canvas. A deactivated tool no longer affects the canvas and all listeners / observers are un-subscribed making the tool available for garbage collection.
        Overrides:
        deactivate in class PaintTool

      • activate

        public void activate(PaintCanvas canvas)
        Description copied from class: PaintTool
        Activates the tool on a given canvas. A paint tool does not "paint" on the canvas until it is activated. Typically, only one tool is active on a canvas at any given time, but there is no technical limitation preventing multiple tools from being active at once. Use PaintTool.deactivate() to stop this tool from painting on the canvas.
        Overrides:
        activate in class PaintTool
        Parameters:
        canvas - The paint canvas on which to activate the tool.

      • isStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled

        public boolean isStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled()
        Determines if the cursor associated with this tool is automatically updated to reflect the shape, color and texture of the paint it will apply. See setStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled(boolean).
        Returns:
        True if stroke tracking is enabled; false otherwise.

      • setStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled

        public void setStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled(boolean strokeTrackingCursorEnabled)
        Sets whether this tool's cursor "tracks" the provisioned stroke and fill, that is, the cursor is automatically updated to represent the shape, color and texture of the paint it will apply. When enabled, any cursor specified via PaintTool.setToolCursor(Cursor) will be overridden. Disable when a custom cursor is desired.
        Parameters:
        strokeTrackingCursorEnabled - When true, the tool cursor represents the shape, color and texture of the paint it will apply; when false, a custom cursor can be specified via PaintTool.setToolCursor(Cursor).

      • isStrokeTrackingCursorScaled

        public boolean isStrokeTrackingCursorScaled()
        Determines if the stroke-tracking cursor is drawn to match the scale of the canvas. Has no effect if the cursor is not actively tracking the stroke (See setStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled(boolean)).
        Returns:
        True if the cursor is being drawn to scale

      • setStrokeTrackingCursorScaled

        public void setStrokeTrackingCursorScaled(boolean strokeTrackingCursorScaled)
        Sets whether the stroke-tracking cursor is drawn to match the scale of the canvas. Has no effect if the cursor is not actively tracking the stroke (See setStrokeTrackingCursorEnabled(boolean)).
        Parameters:
        strokeTrackingCursorScaled - True to make the size of the cursor reflect the scale of the canvas; false to draw the cursor without scaling.
